title: Understanding Cultural Perceptions of Pain
text: Different cultures have varying perceptions and expressions of pain. Some cultures may view expressing pain as a sign of weakness, while others may see it as a natural response.

title: Cultural Stoicism in Pain Expression
text: Certain cultures, such as Black, Japanese, Hispanic, and East Asian, are known for their stoic approach to pain. They may not express pain openly or may avoid requesting pain medication.

title: Religious Views on Pain
text: In some religious communities, such as Muslim or Christian, pain may be viewed as part of a divine plan or a test of faith.

hintAnswer: Black, Japanese, Hispanic, and East Asian cultures
title: Identifying Cultural Attitudes
text: Which cultures tend to appear stoic about pain and may keep an unexpressive face?
choices: Black, Japanese, Hispanic, and East Asian cultures

title: Religious Interpretations of Pain
text: Which religious communities might view pain as part of a higher power's plan?
